title: 177 security personnel died by suicide in Chhattisgarh: Government report
text:
Chhattisgarh government has confirmed that 177 security personnel, including nearly 40 from central forces like CRPF and BSF, died by suicide in the state
Chhattisgarh: Between 2019 and June 15, 2025, 177 security personnel, including 37 from central paramilitary forces, died by suicide in Chhattisgarh, according to a written response presented by Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Sharma in the state Assembly. Sharma, who also holds the Home portfolio, disclosed these figures in reply to a question raised by senior BJP MLA Ajay Chandrakar.
Of the total suicides, 26 were from the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF), five from the Border Security Force (BSF), three from the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP), and one each from the Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB), Central Industrial Security Force (CISF), and Tripura State Rifles. The remaining cases involved personnel from various branches of the state police such as the Chhattisgarh Armed Force, Special Task Force, and Home Guard.
The yearly breakdown of suicides is as follows: 25 in 2019, 38 in 2020, 24 in 2021, 31 in 2022, 22 in 2023, 29 in 2024, and eight in the first half of 2025.
Investigations revealed causes ranging from personal and family issues to alcoholism, health problems, and impulse-related aggression. Additionally, 18 security personnel were found to be involved in murder cases during the same period, including incidents of fratricide where colleagues were killed in internal disputes.
In response, the state government has implemented multiple welfare initiatives aimed at addressing mental health and morale among forces. These include counselling by psychiatrists, yoga and cultural programmes, regular leave policies, de-addiction drives, and grievance redressal systems. The DGP reportedly holds grievance hearings twice a week at Police Headquarters.
(With ANI inputs)
